page.lettertext:
fol.134r
Belgia: 1590: May
Belgia 1590 6 May
Thomas Bodley esq
r
After o
r
verie hartie Commendacons. Whereas there remaineth at
Horne
a shippe belonging to
Hubert Cornelison
laden w
th
Corne, beanes, dealebordes &c, w
ch
stale awaie from the Generalls in the Late
Portugall
voyage, w
th
out their privitie or Consent; w
ch
Corne was Carried out of
this Realme, as appeareth by deposic
o
ns of Certein
sonnes taken before
the Judg of Th'admiralty and other Commission
rs
by us appointed to exa-
mine this Cause: We have thought good to praie and require yo
w
assoone as Convenientlie yo
u
maie, to deale w
th
the
States of Holland
and
the Magistrates of the said towne of Horne that diligent inquirie maie
be made of the quantitie and qualytie of the lading of the said shippe
and where the same or anie
cell thereof is bestowed: and lykewise to
sollicite them that it maie be sold to the uttermost value, that it maie
not be corrupted or embesealed, and that the monney growing of the
sale thereof maie be sequestred to salfe keeping, to be hereafter disbursed
towards the satisfac
o
n of the 44 shippes of the province w
ch
served
in the said Portugall voyage, according as direcc
o
n shalbe given in that
behalfe from the said Generalls.
And so we bid yo
w
verie hartelie
well to fare: From the Court at Greenew
ch
the vj
th
of May
1590
Yo
r
verie loving frends
John Cant
William Burghley
Charles Howard
Hunnsdon
Buckehurst
John Wolley
